summary: This document is email correspondence between attorney Robert Glassman and a U.S. Attorney's Office representative regarding a Touhy request for evidence in the civil case Jane Doe v. Indyke et al. It includes follow-ups and attachments related to the request for information about Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.context: Attorney representing the plaintiff (Jane Doe) in the civil case, sending and following up on a Touhy request for evidence related to Jeffrey Epstein.

Glassman is seeking evidence related to Epstein on behalf of his client in a civil case.

events.title: Initial Touhy Request Submission
events.description: Attorney Robert Glassman submits a formal Touhy request to the U.S. Attorney's Office for tangible and documentary evidence related to Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Response to Touhy Request
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office responds to Robert Glassman's Touhy request with a letter and document production.

keyFacts: A Touhy request (a request for evidence from a federal agency) was made by attorney Robert Glassman to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding Jeffrey Epstein.
The request is part of the civil case Jane Doe v. Indyke et al., SDNY Case No. 1:20-cv-00484-JGK-DCF.
The U.S. Attorney's Office responded to the request with a letter and document production on August 4, 2020.
The correspondence shows ongoing legal efforts to obtain government-held evidence related to Epstein in 2020.
